name: Amb. Dennis Crocker
descriptions: Dennis Crocker is the ambassador to New Vegas for the New California Republic in 2281. His full title, according to the note written to the Courier, is "Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary" of the Department of State.

Ambassador Crocker began his political career as a mayor more than 20 years ago in NCR, and worked his way up through the ranks. He was the head of Kimball's campaign for his successful run for NCR council, which he attributes to why he has his current position. Crocker is a strong believer in diplomacy and hopes to unite the Mojave Wasteland under the NCR peacefully. However, his work has made very little progress since Mr. House refused to even meet him in person after signing the New Vegas Treaty.
Ambassador Crocker is the third successor of the title of ambassador to the Strip following Susanna Edith and Phillip Granger, and is in his seventh year of ambassadorship.

When leaving the Lucky 38 for the first time, the Courier will receive a letter from Crocker delivered by an NCR trooper. In the letter, he requests that they come to speak with him at the NCR Embassy, agreeing to pardon them of any crimes they may have committed against the NCR up to that point.
affiliation: New California RepublicNCR Department of State

topics.topic_text: Want to play a hand of Caravan?
topics.response_text: I always have time for a good game of Caravan. I hope you're up to the challenge.

topics.topic_text: CaravanPlayerLoses
topics.response_text: It looks like you need a bit more practice. Another lesson perhaps?

topics.topic_text: CaravanPlayerWins
topics.response_text: Impressive. That was a very good game. Would you care to play again?

topics.topic_text: I'm all done playing for now.
topics.response_text: Another time then, perhaps.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, let's play again.
topics.response_text: Excellent. Let the game begin!

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Ah, hello. I trust you have something to report concerning the Freeside situation?

topics.topic_text: Tell me about yourself, Ambassador.
topics.response_text: Interested in Politics, huh? Well, grab a seat and get comfortable.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to talk to you about the Boomers.
topics.response_text: I'm glad to see you've given it some thought. Are you willing to go talk to them?

topics.topic_text: I'd like to know more about the NCR.
topics.response_text: That's a conversation we might be able to have some day - once you've shown more respect for my country.

topics.topic_text: Uh... no word yet. I'll get back to you on it.
topics.response_text: You know where to find me.

topics.topic_text: What's happening around the Strip?
topics.response_text: If that's all you came here to talk about, you're wasting my time. Get to the point, or get out of my office.

topics.topic_text: I don't think it's going to work out. Sorry.
topics.response_text: That's disappointing. They could have been a big help to us. I guess we'll just have to do without.

topics.topic_text: <VMS23 Boomer Quest>
topics.response_text: I'm glad you could make it! I have something that I wanted to discuss with you.

topics.topic_text: I'm listening.
topics.response_text: I'm going to keep this as simple as possible so we don't waste each other's time.

topics.topic_text: Sorry, I'm not interested.
topics.response_text: Sorry to hear that. Do me a favor and give it some more thought. I'll be here if you change your mind.

topics.topic_text: Actually, I already know them. We're good friends.
topics.response_text: That's excellent news! So they'll help us?

topics.topic_text: I've met with the Boomers. I don't think it'll work out.
topics.response_text: That's disappointing. They could have been a big help to us. I guess we'll just have to do without.

topics.topic_text: I know where they are. I'll go and talk to them.
topics.response_text: Excellent, come back after you've spoken to them. They should see the benefits of helping us in the long-term.

topics.topic_text: I'll find them and talk to them.
topics.response_text: Much appreciated. Once you've talked to them, let me know what they have to say.

topics.topic_text: About that thing you wanted to talk about, let's hear it.
topics.response_text: I'm going to keep this as simple as possible. The NCR is in a bit of a tight spot with all that's going on, and I need someone like you to help me.

topics.topic_text: The Boomers have agreed to help me.
topics.response_text: Excellent work. I can't tell you how useful that will be.

topics.topic_text: Yes... they will help... "us."
topics.response_text: That's great. They're going to give us an advantage in the battle ahead.

topics.topic_text: Uh... I'm not sure. I'll get back to you.
topics.response_text: Let me know as soon as you have an answer from them.

topics.topic_text: That's enough history for me.
topics.response_text: Oh... very well then. What else can I do for you?

topics.topic_text: Go on.
topics.response_text: Now we mostly just keep track of the NCR citizens and troopers around and make sure they don't get in trouble, but that's Captain Pappas' job.

topics.topic_text: Interesting, go on.
topics.response_text: {Proud}I was elected to this post seven years ago.{Pride escalating}I'm the third NCR representative to serve here in Vegas.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to ask about something else instead.
topics.response_text: {slightly disappointed}Oh yes, sure sure. Ask away.

topics.topic_text: You have my attention, go on.
topics.response_text: To the northeast is a settlement, the locals here call them "Boomers." They are sitting on a munitions stockpile that would be invaluable to us.

topics.topic_text: You have the wrong person.
topics.response_text: I'm sorry that you think so. However, if you do happen to change your mind, you can find me here at the embassy.

topics.topic_text: Earlier you mentioned another assignment?
topics.response_text: So I did. As you may have noticed, our position here in New Vegas is tenuous.

topics.topic_text: I have. It's a slum.
topics.response_text: I'm inclined to agree, but it's a slum with NCR citizens in it, and as such it falls under my jurisdiction.

topics.topic_text: Yes, what of it?
topics.response_text: Violence is something of a way of life there, but there's been a disturbing rise in the number of attacks on our people lately.

topics.topic_text: No, I haven't.
topics.response_text: It's a beastly place. Poverty is rampant, and all that goes with it - drugs, alcohol abuse, the usual.

topics.topic_text: Maybe? I go lots of places. Can't remember them all, you know.
topics.response_text: You'd remember this one. It's a pit where people are robbed, murdered, or simply go to die.

topics.topic_text: Sure, I'll look into it.
topics.response_text: Good. Our men have come up with two different plans for seeing an end to the violence.

topics.topic_text: I think I'll pass.
topics.response_text: That's too bad. Come back if you change your mind. I'm sure you can see yourself out.

topics.topic_text: If I can't just kill him, what did you want me to do?
topics.response_text: Make it look like an accident, or pin the deed on someone else. Look into this guy's affairs, and I'm sure you'll find something you can use.

topics.topic_text: What was I supposed to do again?
topics.response_text: Either kill Pacer in a way that doesn't lead back to us, or talk the King into quelling the violence. It's not really that hard to remember.

topics.topic_text: I've heard that there's bad blood between Pacer and the Van Graff family.
topics.response_text: See, that's exactly the type of information we can use. In fact, that's perfect. Those fancy weapons the Van Graffs peddle aren't exactly common.

topics.topic_text: Pacer's addicted to Jet, even though he has a heart condition.
topics.response_text: That could be useful, but I'm afraid I don't have the background to know how to take advantage of that knowledge.

topics.topic_text: Add a little Psycho to his Jet, and he'd have a heart attack.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Remind me never to get on your bad side. If that's true, then yes, that would be a suitable way to get rid of him.

topics.topic_text: I was hoping you'd know.
topics.response_text: {Wild Wasteland!}Damn it, I'm an ambassador, not a doctor. You'll have to find some other way.

topics.topic_text: I'm not an assassin.
topics.response_text: In that case, we can take a different tack, but one that I at least have more experience with - diplomacy.

topics.topic_text: All right, I'll try to find a way.
topics.response_text: I'm sure something will turn up. If you think you've found something but are unsure, report back and I'll let you know if it's something we can use.

topics.topic_text: What's my other choice?
topics.response_text: I'm not a violent man myself, so I had our guys come up with an alternate solution on the off chance that our agent-to-be shared my sentiments.

topics.topic_text: Let's start with my reward.
topics.response_text: Reward? You want a reward for setting our diplomatic efforts back a year?

topics.topic_text: When you put it that way... yes.
topics.response_text: Oh, I see. You're proud of your efforts, eh? Bah! Thankfully, it looks like we won't be working together any longer.

topics.topic_text: I suppose not.
topics.response_text: At least you've got the sense to know you've screwed up. I'll probably be cleaning toilets by the end of the week. But you'll be busy, too.

topics.topic_text: You wanted a man dead. He's dead. Now where are my caps?
topics.response_text: If it will get you out of my hair, this is a small price to pay. At least I won't have to put up with you any longer.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry. I screwed up.
topics.response_text: That's an understatement. Still, there's nothing to be done about it now. Maybe the violence may die down once things settle.

topics.topic_text: {Dumb option}Wow, you're really mad.
topics.response_text: You better believe I'm mad. You've waged a one man campaign to drag our good name through the mud and I'll be held accountable!

topics.topic_text: I discovered that Pacer and the Van Graffs have a troubled history.
topics.response_text: See, that's exactly the type of information we can use. In fact, that's perfect. Those fancy weapons the Van Graffs peddle aren't exactly common.

topics.topic_text: I discovered that Pacer is a Jet addict and has a heart condition.
topics.response_text: That could be useful, but I'm afraid I don't have the background to know how to take advantage of that knowledge.

topics.topic_text: I used an energy weapon to kill Pacer, so the Van Graffs should take the blame.
topics.response_text: Killing two birds with one stone. Excellent. You've done a great service for the NCR.

topics.topic_text: I risked my neck out there. Couldn't you spare a little more?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Well, I don't officially have access to any more funds, but here. This is from me personally. There's more coming your way, too.

topics.topic_text: I laced Pacer's Jet with Psycho and it didn't go well for him.
topics.response_text: Good show. With the conditions there, no one will suspect anything other than bad drugs to be the culprit. You've done a great service for the NCR.

topics.topic_text: The King complied with Colonel Moore's ultimatum.
topics.response_text: How unexpected! I was sure a direct confrontation would lead to more fighting, but I'm delighted to be proven wrong.

topics.topic_text: Glad to be of service.
topics.response_text: I've received a message from Colonel Moore up at Hoover Dam. She's been following your exploits and has requested that you meet with her.

topics.topic_text: Keep me in mind for any future assignments.
topics.response_text: I would, but I'm afraid the rest of the work in my queue pertains to matters I'll have to deal with personally. You do have another option, however.

topics.topic_text: I spoke to the King, and he promised to stop the violence against NCR citizens.
topics.response_text: That's great to hear. He's got a lot of sway in Freeside, so we can expect a dramatic drop in violence soon.

topics.topic_text: The King won't deal with the NCR.
topics.response_text: That's most unfortunate. In this circumstance I've been instructed to send you along to Colonel Moore over at Hoover Dam for further orders.

topics.topic_text: I'm still working on it.
topics.response_text: I understand. Sometimes these things take time.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> No, I haven't.
topics.response_text: It's a beastly place. Poverty is rampant, and all that goes with it - drugs, alcohol abuse, the usual.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> Sure, what about the place?
topics.response_text: Violence is something of a way of life there, but there's been a disturbing rise in the number of attacks on our people lately.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like you and the Colonel don't get along.
topics.response_text: Oh, I like the Colonel just fine. She's a good soldier, one of the best. I just don't think her general approach to things is a good fit here.

topics.topic_text: That'll show the people in Freeside who's in charge!
topics.response_text: More like instigate a mass riot. People there already think the NCR is trying to take this place over. We'd only be confirming their fears.

topics.topic_text: Sending NCR soldiers into Freeside would be a bad idea.
topics.response_text: I completely agree. Even if a riot didn't immediately break out, a line will have been crossed, and we'll have made that many more enemies.

topics.topic_text: So what do you suggest?
topics.response_text: I'd suggest you speak to Colonel Hsu over at Camp McCarran. He's much more level-headed about this sort of thing.

topics.topic_text: I guess I'll head over to Colonel Moore, then.
topics.response_text: Wait a moment, if you would. While sending you to Colonel Moore is what I'm officially supposed to do, I'd like to propose an alternative.

topics.topic_text: But you've got another idea. Spit it out.
topics.response_text: Is it that obvious? You must understand that while Colonel Moore's job is to get things done, my job is to represent the NCR's best interests.

topics.topic_text: The Kings were all killed after the King turned down the ultimatum.
topics.response_text: I was afraid this would happen. Freeside will be a little more dangerous for a while, but eventually things will die down.

topics.topic_text: The King accepted Colonel Hsu's offer of help.
topics.response_text: Good, good. Hsu's a man you can count on to handle a crisis. I'm just glad that things didn't end in violence.

topics.topic_text: A fight broke out when I presented Hsu's offer. The Kings are all dead.
topics.response_text: That's terrible. I suppose the violence against our people will stop, though.

topics.topic_text: I think I'd rather go with the assassination plan.
topics.response_text: If that's what you prefer, I won't stop you. Just remember to try to find a way to do it that doesn't lead back to the NCR.

topics.topic_text: Add a little Psycho to his Jet, and he'd have a heart attack.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Remind me never to get on your bad side. If that's true, then yes, that would be a suitable way to get rid of him.

topics.topic_text: I was hoping you'd know.
topics.response_text: {Wild Wasteland!}Damn it, I'm an ambassador, not a doctor. You'll have to find some other way.

topics.topic_text: I received my orders from Colonel Moore, and am still carrying them out.
topics.response_text: No doubt Colonel Moore's approach will produce results. Just be ready to duck when the bullets start flying.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about the King.
topics.response_text: He's caucasian, in his mid-30s, and extremely charismatic. It's that last part that we're counting on.

topics.topic_text: What would I need to do?
topics.response_text: Go and talk to the King, try to convince him to put an end to this violence. Pacer's a punk, but he won't likely disobey a direct order.

topics.topic_text: Guess I'll go have a talk with the King, then.
topics.response_text: I wish you luck. If you run into some difficulty and think you'd rather just take the shot with Pacer, that's fine too.

topics.topic_text: I received my orders from Colonel Hsu, and am still carrying them out.
topics.response_text: I trust that Hsu will deal with the matter thoughtfully. Regardless, stay on your toes. There's no telling what will happen.

topics.topic_text: I haven't talked to either Colonel Moore or Colonel Hsu yet.
topics.response_text: Well then don't waste any more time here. Get going!
